New Records: It was the majors' fastest nine-inning game since Armando Galarraga nearly threw a perfect game for Detroit against Cleveland on June 2, 2010. That game was completed in 1 hour, 44 minutes.
It was the fastest nine-inning game for the Cubs since they finished a 3-0 victory over the Reds in 1 hour, 48 minutes on May 24, 2001, at Wrigley, according to the Elias Sports Bureau.
Key Match Events: Jameson Taillon pitched seven crisp innings, allowing four hits, striking out two, and walking two.
Tyson Miller got three outs before Porter Hodge finished the four-hitter for his eighth save.
Nico Hoerner hit a leadoff double, advanced to third on Pete Crow-Armstrong's sacrifice bunt, and scored on Miguel Amaya's sacrifice fly.
Nick Martinez pitched a five-hitter for his first career complete game.
Post-Match Reflections: Jameson Taillon reflected on his performance, stating, 'I had a little bit of a rough patch there in like early, mid-August. To be able to bounce back from that and finish strong is a good feeling.'
Cincinnati interim manager Freddie Benavides commented on the challenging wind conditions, 'With the wind blowing in as hard as it was, it was a challenge.'
Craig Counsell applauded third base coach Willie Harris' decision to send Nico Hoerner on the tricky flyball.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played on a blustery, overcast afternoon at Wrigley Field.
The Cubs clinched a winning season and improved to 4-7 against Cincinnati this year.
Cincinnati failed to advance a runner to third base during the game.
Others: Reds catcher Tyler Stephenson was checked on by a trainer after being clipped by a foul ball but stayed in the game.
Cubs outfielder Seiya Suzuki missed his second straight game due to an ankle injury but is optimistic about playing the next day.
Right-handers Rhett Lowder and Kyle Hendricks are set to pitch in the next game.
